intro: Mesembryanthemum deflectum, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that open in response to sunlight. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss, and it produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. Mesembryanthemum deflectum is popular in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
